isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - STOPMASTER WEDGE TYPE BRAKE - OPERATION - SPRING BRAKE

svcproc.title: SPRING BRAKE
svcproc.para: The spring actuated tandem-type parking brake consists of two connected cylinders. The two cylinders are the spring brake chamber and service brake chamber ( Figure 10).

figure.caption: Figure 10. Service Brake and Spring Brake Chambers

svcproc.para: When 70 psi or more air pressure is applied against the piston, the spring is held in a compressed position. When air pressure is removed, the spring pushes the piston against the diaphragm plate and applies the parking brake.
All spring brake assemblies are equipped with manual caging bolts to permit safe handling ( Figure 11). The spring brake must be caged before any service is performed.

warning.para: The spring brake assemblies must be caged before starting any removal of wheels or drums or servicing air chamber non-pressure half. After parts are reassembled and in place, uncage the spring brake assembly prior to returning the vehicle to service. If disabled vehicle has lost its air pressure, the wheel must be blocked and the spring brake chamber caged prior to moving the vehicle.

International does not recommend disassembly of spring brake chambers. The sudden release of the power spring could cause serious personal injury. The spring brake chamber must be replaced as an assembly if its condition is questionable.

svcproc.para: The breather cap may be removed (for cleaning) after caging the spring brake assembly. The non-pressure half, diaphragm push rod and clamp ring should be serviced as described in AIR CHAMBER ASSEMBLY.
